Maokai is included as well (although in many ways his kit is better designed for top lane)

I feel like his kit is best designed for support role, at least on paper.

The passive works best when 4 people are casting spells instead of 2.
The W has an untargetability so that the support can't interrupt the engage.
The E is a vision tool
The R affects everyone within it, so its effectiveness is maximized when used with a teammate.

His passive works best when fighting top laners like {{champion:92}} who aren't limited by mana and casts multiple spells. But I see where you're coming from. But I think he's not a good support because being able to do all these things means he does them at a mediocre level, making it inefficient.

I haven't tried it since Redemption (for some early mana regeneration), though. Maybe it works better now.

His biggest strength as a support is safety from ganks, I'd say. Sightstone+ saplings provides so much vision. His peel is pretty good. His engage is subpar.

The problem with maokai as a support is that braum basically does what he does only infinitely better. Not only is his cc "Ranged" (maokai actually has to get up close to the enemies in order to use it), but the vision you get from those saplings (only lasting 1min or so, making them a bit meaningless once you get a sightstone) is mitigated by the fact that braum can stop objective steals. Unless you're running a comp specifically around him, then I can't really see why he's worth playing in the support role.

Maokai also has a ranged slow on his saplings. It's mostly useful for weak disengage (when enemy is chasing you) than engage or pick, though.

Saplings also have much longer range than sightstone, so you won't be caught off when going to ward, and you can also ward more areas since saplings don't count as wards. Maokai can provide so much vision, and do so safely. This is useful not only for Dragon and Baron, but also for sieging towers. Not to mention, sightstone has a limited charge system.

There's also that Braum has no quick hard CC besides his ultimate. Maokai has a low cooldown knockup/slow, and a targeted snare.

His vision tool is not as weak as you think. He's not the best support, but he isn't completely outclassed by Braum either.
